benchmark_details.name: 3D-GRAND (A Million-Scale Dataset for 3D-LLMs)
benchmark_details.overview: 3D-GRAND is a pioneering large-scale dataset comprising 40,087 household scenes paired with 6.2 million densely-grounded scene-language instructions designed for grounded 3D instruction tuning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale, densely-grounded 3D-text dataset for improving the performance of 3D language models in understanding and interacting with the physical world.

data.source: Curated from synthetic 3D scenes including 3D-FRONT and Structured3D datasets.
data.annotation: Densely-grounded text annotations generated using a hallucination filter and validated by humans.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the responses of 3D-LLMs to questions about the presence of objects in 3D scenes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision and accuracy indicate better performance in grounding.
methodology.baseline_results: 3D-LLM, LEO, and 3D-VisTA were compared as baseline models.
methodology.validation: Validated through extensive human quality checks with a sample size of 5,100 annotations.
